body.name: UPPAbaby Ridge Jogging Stroller/Durable Performance Jogger with Never-Flat Tires/Built for Walking, Running, Hiking/Water Bottle Holder and Basket Cover Included/Reggie (Slate/Carbon Frame)
body.stockDetail: Only 1 left in stock - order soon.
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Thursday, February 22. Order within 19 hrs 43 mins
features: NEVER FLAT TIRES: No inflation tires mean you can take off and leave the air pump at home! Large 12″ and 16″ foam-filled wheels with a deep tread provide a smooth ride over any terrain.
DISC HAND BRAKE SYSTEM: Reliable performance hand brake on the 4-position handlebar enables you to slow your roll, even when running downhill.
SIMPLE FOOT BRAKE SYSTEM: The intuitive brake system includes a red pedal for braking and a green pedal for engaging. Both are as straightforward to use as they are to see.
PATENTED TWO-STAGE SYSTEM: An advanced responsive suspension system featuring variable coil springs keeps riders comfortable across all terrains, no matter a child’s weight.
COMPACT FOLD & SELF-STANDING: The entire stroller folds easily and quickly with a simple push and twist of one hand. It also conveniently stands when folded.

COMFORT IS KEY: A deep, padded, and reclinable seat with extendable, UPF 50+ canopy keeps child safely and comfortably nestled. The recline swiftly switches passengers from sightseeing to snoozing position.

SWIVEL-LOCKING FRONT WHEEL: At the push of a button, you can lock in the front wheel when going from stroll to run. A visual indicator confirms the mode while the adjustable tracker allows wheel alignment fine-tuning to make the most out of your run.
TRAVEL SYSTEM: Our UPPAbaby Mesa Infant Car Seats attach to the Ridge stroller with convenient adapters to create a complete Performance Travel System.

PIGGYBACK + BASSINET ACCESSORIES: Our Bassinet accessory turns your Ridge into a safe and stylish baby buggy with the addition of adapters. Plus, the Ridge can accommodate a second child with the PiggyBack ride along board accessory. Perfect for young walkers who may need to hitch a ride.
body.description: Go the extra distance with the UPPAbaby RIDGE All-Terrain jogging stroller. Whether you’re a runner, walker, or simply enjoy exploring the outdoors, the RIDGE is optimized for performance to keep you active as a family. • Advanced Responsive Suspension with a patented two-stage system provides a comfortable ride no matter the child weight or terrain • 12” x 16” EVA foam filled tires, eliminates the need to carry an air pump • Disc hand brake system provide advance responsiveness when going downhill or uneven ground surface • Swivel front wheel with lock out and adjustable tracker for jogging mode • One hand fold, stands when folded • XL Adjustable canopy with a zip out UPF 50+ sunshade for more sun protection • Canopy zipper pocket with headphone jack for phone storage • 5-point, no rethread padded harness with lumbar support • Multi-Position, webbing recline with mesh viewing window and cover flap • Water bottle holder included • Covered storage basket with built in pockets and additional bottle holder, hold up to 20 lbs. • Deep padded seat for maximum comfort with side storage pockets for small items • Wrist strap included for safety while jogging • Performance fabrics with water-repellant application • Reflective details on frame and basket to provide added visibility • Infant car set compatible (with adapters sold separately)

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Cover More Ground. Built for performance, the all-terrain Ridge jogger goes more places, at all paces. Smart, adjustable features keep both pusher and passenger comfortable from road to trail to off-the-beaten path. Refined yet durable, the Ridge offers new horizons to explore.

Never Flat Tires No inflation tires mean you can take off and leave the air pump at home. Large 12” and 16” wheels with a deep tread provide a smooth ride over any terrain. Patented Two-Stage System An advanced responsive suspension system featuring variable coil springs keeps riders comfortable across all terrains, no matter a child’s weight. Disc Hand Brake System Reliable performance hand brake on the 4-position handlebar enables you to slow your roll, even when running downhill. Compact Fold & Self-Standing The entire stroller folds easily and quickly with a simple push and twist of one hand. It also conveniently stands when folded.

Rediscover Adventure with Ridge A deep, padded, and reclinable seat with extendable, zip-out UPF 50+ canopy keeps child safely and comfortably nestled. The recline swiftly switches little passengers from sightseeing to snoozing position.

From Birth & Expansion Options Performance Travel System Compatible with Mesa V2, Mesa Max, and More With convenient adapters, take baby from drive to stroll with ease in our Mesa Infant Car Seats or select Maxi-Cosi, Nuna, and Cybex infant car seats. Bassinet Accessory More From Day One Our Bassinet turns your Ridge into a safe and stylish baby buggy with the addition of adapters. PiggyBack Accessory Expand Your Ride The Ridge also accommodates a second child with the PiggyBack ride along board accessory. Perfect for young walkers who may need to hitch a ride.

Specifications What's Included Stroller Water Bottle Holder Basket Cover 12” & 16” never flat tires Suitable from 3 months to 55 lbs Suitable from birth with approved accessories Suitable for jogging when child is able to hold their head up unassisted. Consumer to seek advice from physician on whether child is old enough to run with Dimensions True weight (includes canopy, wheels, and basket): 29.2 lbs Unfolded: 38.5″ L x 26″ W x 40.5″ H Folded: 18.5″ L x 26″ W x 36.5″ H

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great 'all terrain' stroller
reviews.reviewText: We've had our Uppababy Ridge for about 2 months now, and I figured we had enough miles on it to post a review.For context, we have a big/tall baby girl and were transitioning out of a Doona stroller/car seat setup into something that would last from ~6 months until they were able to keep up on their own. We went with the Ridge for an "off road/walking" stroller, and chose another Uppababy model for "around town" activities.This stroller is awesome for what it is. It's about the best I've come across for legitimate outdoor 'all terrain' activities. It has a 'full suspension' system in the body, along with disk brakes that mean it can handle just about any terrain you'd be walking a baby across. I can't vouch for how it does in a mud pit, sand dune, or on Jeep trails though.Both my wife and I use ours several times a week on our parks 3 mile walking trail that has a few sections of broken concrete, and light cedar mulch sections, and the stroller is perfect for that. It glides right over stuff that our Doona (or more in-town oriented Uppababy) stroller would have choked on.We've also taken it to our ranch that is paved with caliche roads that are dusty/very rough on a standard stroller, but this thing has zero problems.So far we have probably ~50-75 miles on the stroller, and it's held up great. It folds down with the flick of a wrist, and I just throw it in the bed of my truck (has enough weight to not blow around/out); fits in the back of my wifes Honda Pilot without an issue.In summary, I'm super impressed with this thing, and I think you'd be very hard pressed to find a better one for the purpose.That said, I would not recommend this stroller as a "one stroller to do everything". Admittedly I was hoping for that initially, but it's just too big/long to use in a grocery store/shop type setting.Hope this helps someone out there!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The Best Stroller
reviews.reviewText: We had an older, used Uppababy Cruze that was excellent quality, so when we decided to switch to a jogging stroller, we knew UB would be worth the money. After comparing this stroller to other brands (Bob, Guava & Thule) this one beat them all for a few major reasons:1. Added hand break. This is so helpful when going down Hill, even while walking b/c it saves your knees. This was something most strollers we didn’t have.2. Added accessories… unlike other UB strollers, this one comes with a covered bottom basket & water bottle. There is SO much storage on this stroller. Deep pocket in the hood & 2 side pockets in child seat.3. Lumbar support for baby4. Front wheel locking. While other strollers have this feature, the UB was easier to use than most b/c it’s a 1 button press5. Suspension in back wheels to absorb shockA few other features we love… disc brakes, wheels are so easy to remove for storage/travel or maintenance, 3yr warranty, the look… very stylish & all fabric is removable to easy washing. I don’t have any complaints. This stroller is perfect for your everyday walk or few mile jogs. It does well on un-smooth surfaces, including small gravel. We’ve taken it over some rocky surfaces, and it did okay. I don’t think most strollers would do well (unless you’re paying a lot more) but if you push it at a slight incline (front wheel up) it’s a lot better to get over whatever rocky surface you need to pass. For the price, this is a great buy!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Just minor complains...
reviews.reviewText: Other reviews have gone through the excellent features this stroller has. One other reason I bought it is because the tires do not need air filling. Yes, air-filled tires are best, but they require a maintenance I know I would not be able to give. These instead has a nice durable surface, never gone flat. The canopy is excellent, and the stroller has several mesh areas to allow breeze in, good if you live in hot climates or go out during summer. Is it comfy? Well my son has taken full on naps while on it.Can you run a 5k with it? YES! We did recently, and the stroller was very nice. Boy never cried or complained, he even was playing with his feet. Handbreak was great for downhill.My complains may have something to do with the fact I am short (5'1"). The "easy fold and unfold" is not so easy for me. I'm always figuring where to twist and pull the handle, and push the wheels to open it up. Not a big deal, but I think it is not as easy as others put it. Also, although the handlebar is adjustable, the lowest setting is about the upper limit for my comfort. Especially when my no frills car seat stroller frame has a much lower adjustment.And yea, I want to point out this is the model AFTER the recall, so the problem it had with the disc brakes was fixed before this was shipped.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Such a great stroller!
reviews.reviewText: I love this stroller. I purchased it specifically for walks and jogging and it rides so smooth. Love the hand brake option and love how much room the basket has. Wish I bought it sooner

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars 10/10 would buy again!
reviews.reviewText: Very sturdy, heavy duty quality but a lightweight design. Turns on a dime and is super easy to navigate! Best stroller!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Perfect stroller with so many add on options!!! Will have through out every baby stage.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic go anywhere stroller!
reviews.reviewText: My neighborhood streets are more potholes than pavement, so this stroller is a lifesaver! Disregard the negative reviews about the recall, this is the updated 2023 the model with no large holes in the disc brakes!! Would highly recommend!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The suspension on this is amazing. We brought the stroller out for long hikes in NZ and loved every second of it. Its not a light stroller and its weight poses challenges but what it can do far outweighs that. Pushes like a dream over all but the worst of terrains. Would highly recommend to those looking for an active lifestyle.
